snippet: At a time when gun issues are volatile nationally and sales are increasing, many minority gun owners are trying to balance the pros and cons of ownership with the N.R.A.’s unyielding stances.
abstract: Minority gun owners, whether black, Latino or Asian, struggle to balance their feelings about the conservatism and unyielding political stances of the National Rifle Association with the reality of a need for self-defense; blacks are less likely than whites to own a gun and even less likely to attend NRA conventions and events; there are signs, however, that gun proponents and the NRA are gaining ground among minority groups.
lead_paragraph: At a time when gun issues are volatile nationally and sales are increasing, many minority gun owners are trying to balance the pros and cons of ownership with the N.R.A.’s unyielding stances.

headline.main: Minority Gun Owners Face Balancing Act, Weighing Isolation and Stigma of Violence
headline.print_headline: Minority Gun Owners Face Balancing Act, Weighing Isolation and Stigma of Violence
